article_title: Q&A with Pat Geraghty, CEO of Florida Blue: Insuring health in the Sunshine Economy
article_text:
Pat Geraghty is CEO of the state’s largest health insurer, Florida Blue

He sees Florida’s marketplace as one of the most competitive in the nation and says his company will maintain its traditional role of being a healthcare insurer, not a provider

Geraghty shares views on how Obamacare is affecting the business models of some of his competitors

article_metadata.news-keywords: Pat Geraghty, CEO, Florida Blue, health insurance, South Florida, Obamacare
article_metadata.description: Florida leads the nation again for the number of people signing up for individual health insurance as required by the Affordable Care Act — Obamacare. Over the first five weeks of open enrollment in the fall, 600,000 Floridians signed up. Twice as many are expected to eventually sign up once all of the enrollment periods expire on Sunday. Signing up by then gets coverage beginning March 1.
